DataElement.preferredName: Neoplasm Excision to Freeze Time Less Than 5 Minutes Occurrence Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether the time from tumor removal (excision) to freezing was less than five minutes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neoplasm Excision to Freeze Time Less Than 5 Minutes Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::5_A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.:To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::5:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
